result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle W Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

AODA and comply.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after one year, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  Maintain full time work, or school, or treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

filed by defendant, requesting confirmation, does he need to be present for hearing on 8-22-16.
7/12/16 - copy to Atty. Genda & PAP - if paid in full, hrg. can come off, if not, stays on per Judge V.  man
Probation review hearing on August 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Filed by ADA Christine M. Genda, requesting a probation review hearing prior to 8-28-16.
Defendant to be discharged from probation on 8-28-16; unpaid restitution of $934.87 and court obligations of $584.10
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Restitution stipulation in the probation amount of $1411.06 and total of $1552.16.

Defendant, Kyle W Schultz, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim impact statement filed by ADA Burdon.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation include $453.00 costs.  Maintain full time work, school, or treatment. Restitution $1552.16 this includes the surcharge.  AODA and comply.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after one year, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  Defendant is to report to probation by 4pm on Monday.
No contact with the Wal-Mart in Portage.  Standard misd. conditions.

Defendant, Kyle W Schultz, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  No contact with Portage, Wal-Mart.  Standard misd. conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
